title: Rotative cylinder compressor for energy efficient industrial compression process
abstract: Gas compression with piston reciprocating compressors dates from 19th century and it is widely used today for a vast range of industrial applications. The process of compression is energetically inefficient as just ten percent of the energy consumed becomes mechanical energy as compressed gas, being the rest of the energy wasted in heating the gas, energy that must be dissipated incurring an additional energy expenditure. ABC COMPRESSORS has developed the Rotating Cylinder Compressor (CCR â€“ Compresor Cilindros Rotativos) which adopts a disruptive concept of piston compression based in centrifugal forces. This new compressor concept enables to reduce up to 20% the energetic consumption of compressors eliminating the need of water cooling and reducing considerably the dimension (and constructive cost) of the compressor.  Oil and Gas market is outlined as principal market for this project due to the big size of the market (around 50% of global compressors), growing trends, and market pressure for reduce energy consumption. More than 10.000 compressors are sold nowadays, and it is expected to have a steadily growth due to natural gas plants proliferation and old compressors replacing market in Europe and US. Taking into account existing needs, potential market, ABC COMPRESSORS` strength and knowledge in high pressure compressors and industrial markets and the possession of patented superior technology (reduction of energy consumption, reduction of price and simplicity), a clear business opportunity for ABC COMPRESSORS is outlined. In this Phase 1 project, a feasibility study will be held to analyse the viability of the whole project, analysing market, product, business and financial features in order to guarantee the profitability of the investment in the identified markets and future scenarios.

motivations: Conventional piston reciprocating compressors are energetically inefficient, wasting a significant amount of energy as heat.
There is a growing market demand for energy-efficient compression solutions, particularly in the Oil and Gas industry.
objectives: Develop and commercialize the Rotating Cylinder Compressor (CCR) technology to reduce energy consumption in industrial compression processes.
Conduct a feasibility study to analyze the viability of the CCR project and guarantee its profitability in the identified markets.
methods: Utilize a disruptive concept of piston compression based on centrifugal forces to reduce energy consumption.
Conduct market, product, business, and financial analyses to assess the project's viability.
results: Reduce energy consumption in compressors by up to 20% and eliminate the need for water cooling.
Decrease the dimension and constructive cost of compressors, making them more efficient and cost-effective.
llama_json.research_subject: Development of energy-efficient Rotating Cylinder Compressor technology for industrial applications

motivations: Current gas compression methods are energy inefficient, with a large portion of energy wasted in heating the gas.
There is a growing need in the Oil and Gas market to reduce energy consumption and costs.
objectives: Develop a Rotating Cylinder Compressor (CCR) that adopts a disruptive concept of piston compression based on centrifugal forces.
Reduce the energy consumption of compressors by up to 20%, eliminate the need for water cooling, and significantly reduce the size and construction cost of the compressor.
Conduct a feasibility study to analyze the viability of the project, considering market, product, business, and financial features.
methods: Develop a new compressor concept based on centrifugal forces.
Eliminate the need for water cooling and reduce the size of the compressor to cut costs.
Conduct a feasibility study to assess market, product, business, and financial aspects.
results: Achieve up to 20% reduction in energy consumption of compressors.
Eliminate the need for water cooling and significantly reduce the size and construction cost of compressors.
Identify a clear business opportunity for ABC COMPRESSORS in the Oil and Gas market.
openai_json.research_subject: Development of an energy-efficient Rotating Cylinder Compressor for industrial applications

motivations: Traditional piston reciprocating compressors are energetically inefficient, with only 10% of consumed energy converted to mechanical energy while the rest is wasted as heat.
The oil and gas industry requires more energy-efficient compression solutions due to market pressure to reduce energy consumption and operational costs.
objectives: Develop and commercialize the Rotating Cylinder Compressor (CCR) technology to achieve up to 20% reduction in energy consumption compared to traditional compressors.
Conduct a comprehensive feasibility study to analyze market viability, product features, and business potential for the CCR technology in the oil and gas sector.
methods: Implement a disruptive piston compression concept based on centrifugal forces through the Rotating Cylinder Compressor design.
Perform market, product, business, and financial analyses to evaluate the profitability and investment viability of the CCR technology.
results: Achieve significant energy savings of up to 20% while eliminating the need for water cooling systems.
Reduce compressor dimensions and construction costs compared to traditional reciprocating compressors.
Position ABC COMPRESSORS to capture market share in the growing oil and gas compressor market.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Energy-efficient rotative cylinder compressor technology for industrial gas compression
